name: Log Portal Demo
description: A demo of a log discovery portal using a scheduled view to summarize ingested logs.
title: Log Portal Demo

panels.title: Log Portal Demo
panels.text: Use this dashboard to discover logs to search in your sumo logic instance using a pre-aggregated summary view of ingested metadata.

panels.title: These panels show values found for each matching metadata for your search scope
panels.text:
Logs have built in metadata fields assigned to them at ingestion time, set by administrators when collection is configured. For more info see [built in metadata](https://help.sumologic.com/docs/search/get-started-with-search/search-basics/built-in-metadata/) These are: ```Index (_view), _sourcecategory,  _collector,  _source, _sourcename,  and _sourcehost```. 

Logs are ingested into **partitions** also called **indexes** based on routing configured by administrators.  [Partitions](https://help.sumologic.com/docs/manage/partitions/) are logical containers where your logs that are ingested are stored so scoping a search to one or a few partitions will improve performance and reduce scan. If no routing is specified the data is ingested into the ```sumologic_default ``` partition.

panels.title: Using Filters On This Dashboard
panels.text:
Metadata filters are applied to view as [keyword expressions](https://help.sumologic.com/docs/search/get-started-with-search/build-search/keyword-search-expressions) for example: collector = <collector>.  ``` collector = {{collector}}```

If the string contains spaces quote it: ```"my category"``` or replace space with single character wildcard: ? e.g. ```my?category```

The parameter **global_regex_search** is a [case insensitive regular expression](https://help.sumologic.com/docs/search/search-query-language/search-operators/matches/#matching-with-regex-to-filter-results) applied vs all metadata string values. Examples of regular expressions:
|  regex  |  Examples |
|---|---|
| .*  |  Any string "0 to many of any character.  . = any character |
| foo  | matches: foo, foobar, xxfooxx, etc  | 
| ab*c  | matches: abc, abbbbbc or ac. * = 0 to many of prededing chr.  |
| foo\|ba. | any string containing foo or bar. |


The filter parameters you have selected are applied to the custom view as below:
```
_view=metadata_default_v1
sourcecategory = {{sourcecategory}}
collector = {{collector}}
index = {{index}}
sourcehost = {{sourcehost}}
| where concat(collector,index,source,sourcecategory,sourcehost) matches /(?i){{global_regex_search}}/
```

panels.title: Open a New Search Window - Use Clickable Links To Start a Log Search
Search Activity In Your Account
panels.text:
These panels use [search audit](https://help.sumologic.com/docs/manage/security/audit-indexes/search-audit-index/) and show examples of searches likely to match the metadata scope variables you have selected.

### Saved Content
 If the content is saved in library or is a monitor or SLO the saved content name is shown.

queries.queryString:
_view=sumologic_search_usage_per_query  
not query_type="Scheduled Views"
| where ("{{global_regex_search}}" = ".*") or (query matches /(?i){{global_regex_search}}/)

// we have a real pickle here because users could provide "foo" foo?bar foo*bar foo* etc and not valid to match vs query which is a much larger string
// reformat the supplied params into a single result
//| concat("{{sourcecategory}}|{{collector}}|{{index}}|{{sourcehost}}","") as blob
| "{{sourcecategory}}" as blob 
| if(substring(blob,0,1)="*",blob,concat("*",blob)) as blob 
| substring(blob,length(blob)-1,length(blob)) as end
| if( end = "*",blob,concat(blob,"*")) as blob
| where query matches blob
| "{{collector}}" as blob 
| if(substring(blob,0,1)="*",blob,concat("*",blob)) as blob 
| substring(blob,length(blob)-1,length(blob)) as end
| if( end = "*",blob,concat(blob,"*")) as blob
| where query matches blob
| "{{index}}" as blob 
| if(substring(blob,0,1)="*",blob,concat("*",blob)) as blob 
| substring(blob,length(blob)-1,length(blob)) as end
| if( end = "*",blob,concat(blob,"*")) as blob
| where query matches blob
| "{{sourcehost}}" as blob 
| if(substring(blob,0,1)="*",blob,concat("*",blob)) as blob 
| substring(blob,length(blob)-1,length(blob)) as end
| if( end = "*",blob,concat(blob,"*")) as blob
| where query matches blob

//| json field =scanned_bytes_breakdown "Infrequent" as scan_inf  
//| ((query_end_time - query_start_time ) /1000 / 60 ) as range_minutes
//| execution_duration_ms / 1000 as runtime
| content_name as name | trim(query) as q
| if(length(query)>500,concat(substring(query,0,500),"..."),query) as query
//| first(q) as q,count as searches,avg(range_minutes) as %"range(m)",avg(scanned_partition_count) as partitions, sum(data_scanned_bytes) as scan_bytes,avg(runtime) as avg_runtime by query_type,name,query //,session_id
| first(q) as q,count as searches by query_type,name,query //,session_id
| sort name asc, query asc | limit 1000
//| round(scan_bytes / 1G,1) as scan_gb | fields -scan_bytes
//| round(avg_runtime,1) as %"runtime(s)"
//| round(%"range(m)",1) as %"range(m)"
| trim(concat("// ",query_type," ",name)) as qn 
| trim(query) as query
| urlencode (concat(qn,"\n",q)) as q
| "https://{{my_instance_name}}.sumologic.com/ui/#/search/create?query=" as dp
| concat("[run search](",dp,q,")") as %"Run Search"
| fields -dp,q,qn

_view=sumologic_search_usage_per_query  
not query_type="Scheduled Views"
| where ("{{global_regex_search}}" = ".*") or (query matches /(?i){{global_regex_search}}/)

// we have a real pickle here because users could provide "foo" foo?bar foo*bar foo* etc and not valid to match vs query which is a much larger string
// reformat the supplied params into a single result
//| concat("{{sourcecategory}}|{{collector}}|{{index}}|{{sourcehost}}","") as blob
| "{{sourcecategory}}" as blob 
| if(substring(blob,0,1)="*",blob,concat("*",blob)) as blob 
| substring(blob,length(blob)-1,length(blob)) as end
| if( end = "*",blob,concat(blob,"*")) as blob
| where query matches blob
| "{{collector}}" as blob 
| if(substring(blob,0,1)="*",blob,concat("*",blob)) as blob 
| substring(blob,length(blob)-1,length(blob)) as end
| if( end = "*",blob,concat(blob,"*")) as blob
| where query matches blob
| "{{index}}" as blob 
| if(substring(blob,0,1)="*",blob,concat("*",blob)) as blob 
| substring(blob,length(blob)-1,length(blob)) as end
| if( end = "*",blob,concat(blob,"*")) as blob
| where query matches blob
| "{{sourcehost}}" as blob 
| if(substring(blob,0,1)="*",blob,concat("*",blob)) as blob 
| substring(blob,length(blob)-1,length(blob)) as end
| if( end = "*",blob,concat(blob,"*")) as blob
| where query matches blob

//| json field =scanned_bytes_breakdown "Infrequent" as scan_inf  
//| ((query_end_time - query_start_time ) /1000 / 60 ) as range_minutes
//| execution_duration_ms / 1000 as runtime
| content_name as name | trim(query) as q
| if(length(query)>500,concat(substring(query,0,500),"..."),query) as query
//| first(q) as q,count as searches,avg(range_minutes) as %"range(m)",avg(scanned_partition_count) as partitions, sum(data_scanned_bytes) as scan_bytes,avg(runtime) as avg_runtime by query_type,name,query //,session_id
| count by query_type | sort query_type asc

sourceDefinition.query:
_view=metadata_default_v1 | count by sourcecategory
| sort by sourcecategory asc

_view=metadata_default_v1
| count by collector
| sort by collector asc
_view=metadata_default_v1 | count by index | sort index asc

_view=metadata_default_v1 | count by sourcehost
| sort by sourcehost desc
